note.p: Education: Magdalen Hall, Oxford; BA (1671), MA (1673); Incorporated at Cambridge (1680); Corpus Christi College, Cambridge; MD (1681)
Career: Professor of Physic, Gresham College, London; Physician, Bridewell and Bethlehem Hospitals; lectured on anatomy to the Barber Surgeons
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Venn; Hunter; Foster; Gunther
References: Jonathan Andrews, 'A Respectable Mad-Doctor? Dr Richard Hale, FRS (1670-1728)' in NR 1990 vol 44 pp 169-203
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166
Notes: DSB gives birthdate as 20/01/1650 or 1651 and place of birth as Bristol
